trans-unit.source: Provides an abstract base class for a page parser filter that is used by the ASP.NET parser to determine whether an item is allowed in the page at parse time.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.PageParserFilter"></xref> class.
Adds a <xref href="System.Web.UI.ControlBuilder"></xref> object in the page control tree at the current page parser position.
<xref:System.Web.UI.PageParserFilter.AddControl%2A> is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5.
For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).
The control type that the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ControlBuilder"></xref> represents.
The <xref href="System.Collections.IDictionary"></xref> object that holds all the specified tag attributes.
Determines whether the page can be derived from the specified <xref href="System.Type"></xref>.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateParser> class determines whether a base type is permitted.
A <xref href="System.Type"></xref> that represents the potential base class of the current page.
`true` if the page can inherit from the specified type; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Gets a value indicating whether an ASP.NET parser filter permits code on the page.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateParser> class checks any associated <xref:System.Web.UI.PageParserFilter> instance to determine whether a page can contain code that can be compiled.
`true` if a parser filter permits code; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Gets a value indicating whether the specified control type is allowed for this page.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateParser> class checks to see whether controls are permitted in a page at parse time.
Override the <xref:System.Web.UI.PageParserFilter.AllowControl%2A> method to reject or permit specific controls in your pages.
A <xref href="System.Type"></xref> that represents the type of control to add.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.ControlBuilder"></xref> used to build the specified type of control.
`true` if the control can be used with the current page; otherwise, `false`.
The default value is `false`.
Determines whether a parser permits a specific server-side include on a page.
Override the <xref:System.Web.UI.PageParserFilter.AllowServerSideInclude%2A> method to reject all or specific server-side includes.
For more information about server-side include syntax, see [Server-Side Include Directive Syntax](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/42a6925a-f68c-4690-a9c4-d710358886a9).
The virtual path to the included file.
`true` if a parser permits the specific server-side include; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Determines whether a parser permits a virtual reference to a specific type of resource on a page.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateParser> class determines whether a particular type of resource can be referenced from a page.
The virtual path to a resource, such as a master page file, ASP.NET page, or user control.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.VirtualReferenceType"></xref> value that identifies the type of resource.
`true` if the parser permits a virtual reference to a specific type of resource; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value that indicates whether the parser filter was called from the page.

This property is set to `true` when an implementation of the <xref:System.Web.UI.PageParserFilter> class is invoked by calling the `ParseControl` method of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page> class or by calling the `ParseControl` method of the `TemplateControl` reference of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page> class.
`true` if a parser filter was called from the page; otherwise, `false`.
Retrieves the current compilation mode for the page.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateControlParser> class checks any associated <xref:System.Web.UI.PageParserFilter> instance to apply a compilation mode to the currently processed page.

The default implementation of the <xref:System.Web.UI.PageParserFilter.GetCompilationMode%2A> method simply returns the <xref:System.Web.UI.CompilationMode> value that is passed in the current parameter.
Override the <xref:System.Web.UI.PageParserFilter.GetCompilationMode%2A> method to use a specific or different <xref:System.Web.UI.CompilationMode> value.
The current compilation mode for the page.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.CompilationMode"></xref> values.
Returns a <xref href="System.Type"></xref> that should be used for pages or controls that are not dynamically compiled.

You can override the <xref:System.Web.UI.PageParserFilter.GetNoCompileUserControlType%2A> method to specify the return type of pages or controls that are treated as if they are not dynamically compiled.
The default is `null`.
<xref:System.Web.UI.PageParserFilter.GetNoCompileUserControlType%2A> is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5.
For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).
The return <xref href="System.Type"></xref> that should be used for pages or controls that are not dynamically compiled.
The default is `null`.
Initializes a filter used for a page.

Because the <xref:System.Web.UI.PageParserFilter> class does not expose well-defined public constructors, it is initialized by the page parsers that use the <xref:System.Web.UI.PageParserFilter.Initialize%2A> method.

Override the <xref:System.Web.UI.PageParserFilter.Initialize%2A> method to add your own custom initialization steps when an instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.PageParserFilter> is created and used by ASP.NET.
The `virtualPath` parameter passed to the <xref:System.Web.UI.PageParserFilter.Initialize%2A> method sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.PageParserFilter.VirtualPath%2A> property, and cannot be `null`.
Gets the line number that is currently being parsed in the file.
In a custom <xref:System.Web.UI.PageParserFilter> implementation, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.PageParserFilter.Line%2A> property to report where errors occur during parsing.
<xref:System.Web.UI.PageParserFilter.Line%2A> is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5.
For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).
The integer value representing the line in the file that the parser filter is currently processing.
Gets the maximum number of controls that a parser filter can parse for a single page.

The ASP.NET page parser keeps track of the controls it parses, and if the number exceeds the limit set by a <xref:System.Web.UI.PageParserFilter> instance, it throws an <xref:System.Web.HttpException> exception.
The maximum number of controls a parser filter can parse for a page.
The default value is 0, which indicates that no controls are parsed.
Gets the maximum number of direct file dependencies that the page parser permits for a single page.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateParser> class keeps track of the number of direct and indirect file dependencies it parses, and if the number exceeds the limit set by a <xref:System.Web.UI.PageParserFilter> instance, it throws an exception.
The maximum number of direct file dependencies the page parser can parse for a page.
The default is 0, which that indicates no dependencies are allowed.
Called by an ASP.NET page parser to notify a filter when the parsing of a page is complete.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.ControlBuilder"></xref> associated with the page parsing.
Allows the page parser filter to preprocess page directives.
The page parser calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.PageParserFilter.PreprocessDirective%2A> method for each directive encountered during parsing.
The page directive.
A collection of attributes and values parsed from the page.
Returns a value that indicates whether a code block should be processed by subsequent parser filters.
You can override the <xref:System.Web.UI.PageParserFilter.ProcessCodeConstruct%2A> method to parse code contained in code constructs when implementing a custom <xref:System.Web.UI.PageParserFilter>.
After processing the code, this method returns `true` if the parser should process the code further; otherwise, it returns `false`.
The type of allowed code constructs are the <xref:System.Web.UI.CodeConstructType> enumeration values.
<xref:System.Web.UI.PageParserFilter.ProcessCodeConstruct%2A> is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5.
For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.CodeConstructType"></xref> enumeration values that identifies the type of the code construct.
The string literal that contains the code inside the code construct.
`true` if the parser should process a code construct further; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Returns a value that indicates whether the parser filter processes a data binding expression in an attribute.

You can override the <xref:System.Web.UI.PageParserFilter.ProcessDataBindingAttribute%2A> method to allow the parser filter to process data binding expressions when implementing a custom <xref:System.Web.UI.PageParserFilter> class.
An example of a data binding expression used with an attribute is `<%# expression %>`.
<xref:System.Web.UI.PageParserFilter.ProcessDataBindingAttribute%2A> is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5.
For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).
The ID of the control that contains the data binding attribute.
The name of the attribute with the data binding expression.
The data binding expression.
`true` if the parser filter processes data binding attributes; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Returns a value that indicates whether event handlers should be processed further by the parser filter.

You can override the <xref:System.Web.UI.PageParserFilter.ProcessEventHookup%2A> method to allow the parser to process event hookups when implementing a custom <xref:System.Web.UI.PageParserFilter> class.
An example of an event handler is providing a handler for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Button.Click> event of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Button> control.
<xref:System.Web.UI.PageParserFilter.ProcessEventHookup%2A> is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5.
For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).
The ID of the control whose event has the event handler to process.
The event name of the controlID to filter on.
The handler of the eventName name to filter on.
`true` if the parser processes event handlers; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.

Sets a property on a control derived from the <xref href="System.Web.UI.TemplateControl"></xref> class, which includes the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Page"></xref>, <xref href="System.Web.UI.UserControl"></xref>, and <xref href="System.Web.UI.MasterPage"></xref> controls.
<xref:System.Web.UI.PageParserFilter.SetPageProperty%2A> is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5.
For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).
A string containing the value of the filter on an expression.
For an example, see <xref href="System.Web.UI.PropertyEntry"></xref>.
The name of the property to set a value for.
The value of the property to set.
Gets the maximum number of direct and indirect file dependencies that the page parser permits for a single page.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateParser> class keeps track of the number of direct and indirect file dependencies it parses, and if the number exceeds the limit set by a <xref:System.Web.UI.PageParserFilter> instance, it throws an exception.
The maximum number of direct and indirect file dependencies the page parser can parse for a page.
The default is 0, which indicates that no dependencies are allowed.
Gets the virtual path to the page currently being parsed.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.PageParserFilter.VirtualPath%2A> property is never `null`.
A virtual path to an ASP.NET page.
